newsitem.title: ITALY: SOCCER-JUVENTUS BEAT PSG TO WIN EUROPEAN SUPER CUP.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-JUVENTUS BEAT PSG TO WIN EUROPEAN SUPER CUP.

text.p: Juventus, completing an academic task, won the European Super Cup on Wednesday when they beat Paris St Germain 3-1 in the second leg after routing the French side 6-1 in the first leg last month.
Alessandro Del Piero gave the European champions the lead with a well-taken goal in the 30th minute.
Brazilian Rai equalised from the penalty spot in the 64th minute but Del Piero made it 2-1 six minutes later.

Substitute striker Christian Vieri, seconds after seriously testing goalkeeper Bernard Lama with a brilliant stop and volley from the edge of the area, headed in the third goal in injury time from a Del Piero cross.
The Juventus victory in the Super Cup, contested by the European Cup and Cup Winners' Cup holders, was largely academic given the Italians' 6-1 advantage from last month's first leg in Paris.
But both sides played exciting football in front of 35,000 fans in Palermo, where Juventus had obtained UEFA permission to play as attendance was expected to be low in their home city of Turin.
